name: slur

slur verb [T]
(PRONOUNCE BADLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to pronounce the sounds of a word in a way that is wrong or not clear: Her speech was slurred but she still denied she was drunk.

slur noun
(CRITICISM)
[ C ] a remark that criticizes someone and is likely to have a harmful effect on their reputation: Her letter contained several outrageous slurs against/on her former colleagues. His comments cast a slur on the integrity of his employees.
[ C ] an offensive word used to insult someone because of their race, sexuality (= the fact of being sexually attracted to people of a particular gender), etc.: Tyres were slashed and a racial slur was painted on their car. The man swore at an officer and used a homophobic slur.

(PRONOUNCE BADLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to pronounce words in a way that is not clear: [ T ] How can you possibly understand someone who slurs his speech?
slur noun [C]
(INSULT)
words intended to insult someone or injure someone's reputation: He apologized for shouting an ethnic slur at a fan.
slur noun [C]
(UNCLEAR SPEECH)
the act of pronouncing words in a way that is not clear: The injury made her speak with a slur.
